about.title: About Us
about.subtitle: More than 25 years of history
about.description: Discover the history of Tunadão 1998, the academic tuna of the Polytechnic Institute of Viseu. More than 25 years of tradition and music.

historyText.p1: Tunadão was born in 1998, from the desire of a group of students at the Polytechnic Institute of Viseu to create an academic tuna that would represent the institution and the city of Viseu. The name "Tunadão" comes from the combination of "Tuna" with "Dão", the wine region where Viseu is located, creating a unique identity representative of its roots.
historyText.p2: Since its founding, Tunadão has been a reference in Viseu's academic life, participating in dozens of festivals throughout the country and abroad, winning awards and recognition for its musical work and the quality of its performances.
historyText.p3: In 2004, Tunadão started one of its greatest achievements: CITADÃO - International Competition of Academic Tunas of Dão. This festival has become one of the most important events in the national tuna calendar, bringing together annually the best tunas in the country and international guests.
historyText.p4: With more than 25 years of history, Tunadão continues to train new members, preserve academic traditions and bring Portuguese music and tuna culture to stages from north to south of the country. The tuna maintains a diverse repertoire that includes traditional Portuguese songs, original compositions and adaptations of popular themes.

about.title: What is CITADÃO?
about.p1: CITADÃO - Certame Internacional de Tunas Académicas do Dão is an academic tuna festival organized by Tunadão since 2004. Held annually in Viseu, the festival brings together the best tunas in the country and international guests for two days of music, camaraderie and competition.
about.p2: With {count} editions held, CITADÃO has become a reference in the national tuna scene, awarding musical excellence, creativity and academic spirit.
